result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Javian R Olds

defendant.name: Olds, Javian R
defendant.address: 10010 E County Rd N, Whitewater, WI 53190

records.addlTxt: Initial appearance on January 9, 2023 at 10:30 am.

[MK] cases #22CF253, #22CF274 called at 3:01pm
Defendant Javian R Olds in court.  ADA Jeffrey Shock in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
After the Court cites the lengthy time-length involved with the Public Defenders efforts to appoint counsel, and indicates that the Court is considering court-appointment of counsel, Mr. Olds requests that the Court continue to await the PD appointment of counsel. 
The Court continues to toll time limits in Case #22CF274
The Court informs Mr. Olds that the cases will likely be re-assigned to a different judge due to a judicial rotation scheduled at the beginning of the new year. At the time he receives notice, he will have the right to substitution of judge. 
recess 3:04pm 

NEXT:  Status Conference (status of PD counsel) in case #22CF253 and Adjourned Initial Appearance in #22CF274--both on January 9th at 10:30am  (both cases are at prelim stage)
OSPD APPOINTMENT OF COUNSEL REPORT - 449 contacts and no attorney has accepted the appointment.
Status conference on October 31, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

[ml] Cases 22CF253 and 22CF274 called at 1:31PM
Defendant Javian R Olds in court, without counsel. ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court notes that the Defendant has not yet been appointed counsel, and sets this matter over for another Status Conference with enough time for the Public Defender to continue to find counsel for the Defendant.

The Court continues to toll Preliminary Hearing time limits in file 22CF274.

recess 1:34PM

NEXT: Status Conference (also Status of Counsel) on 10/31 at 2:30PM with in person appearances
Status conference on August 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Javian R Olds
Current: 10010 E County Rd N, Whitewater, WI 53190 United States  (Effective: 06-28-2022)
Prior: 307 Park St. #5, Fort Atkinson, WI 53538

[MK] cases #22CF253, #22CF274 called at 8:44am 
Defendant Javian R Olds in court. ADA Michael Witt appears for the State of Wisconsin.
These cases are scheduled for Preliminary Hearings today and the State's officer-witnesses are present.  However the State Public Defender's Office has notified the Court that they are continuing efforts to find an available attorney to appoint as counsel for Mr. Olds.
Mr. Olds indicates that he continues to want representation by counsel in these cases.
As to Case #22CF274, the Court tolls preliminary hearing time limits.
recess 8:48am
[off record:  In response to the Court's inquiry of Mr. Olds regarding address, Mr. Olds indicates his address is 307 Park St. #5 in Fort Atkinson.] 

NEXT:  Status Conference (status of counsel hearing) on August 18th at 1:30pm -JA note in comments that the cases are at prelim-stage, and that in case #22CF274 the time limit was tolled
Preliminary hearing on June 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

[MK] case called at 1:57pm
Defendant Javian R Olds appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Cassi Nelson (the PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 
The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
In response to the Court's inquiry regarding the Preliminary Hearing time limit, Attorney Nelson requests that this case be scheduled on June 28th when Mr. Olds has another case scheduled. 
During bond arguments, the alleged victim makes a statement requesting that a signature bond not be set. 
The Court requires a $1,500 Signature Bond with conditions:
--not to commit any acts or threats of violence
--no contact with Victim 1
--no presence at Victim 1's residence, with the exception that Mr. Olds may return one time, in the escort of law enforcement, to retrieve his what is legally and personally his; law enforcement will afford Mr. Olds no less than one hour to do so. 
--no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no possession of drug paraphernalia
recess 2:06pm. 

NEXT:  Preliminary Hearing on June 28th at 8:30am

Victim Witness Key
